articles.description: Stressing that Vitamin D is inexpensive and has negligible risk when compared to the considerable risk of Covid-19, global researchers on the disease have asked governments to make it part of their strategy against the novel coronavirus.
articles.content: There is no clinical evidence to prove low levels of Vitamin D lead to severe Covid-19 symptoms but there is a definite connect between the “sunshine vitamin” and immune responses to the disease, say… [+5747 chars]

articles.title: Fauci says US can return to normal by fall if it puts aside slow start and is diligent about vaccinations - CNN
articles.description: If states are able to "diligently vaccinate" people against the coronavirus next year, the US could return to normal life by early fall, Dr. Anthony Fauci said Wednesday in an Facebook interview with California Gov. Gavin Newsom.

articles.author: Samantha Kubota
articles.title: Family devastated after ‘perfectly healthy’ 18-year-old dies of COVID-19 - TODAY
articles.description: Sarah Simental of Tinley Park, Illinois, 18, died three days after being admitted to the hospital. Her mother, Deborah Simental, said the teen was "perfectly healthy" and had no underlying conditions.
articles.content:
One Chicago-area mother is warning people to stay home after her perfectly healthy teenage daughter died just three days after being hospitalized for the coronavirus.
